Message: 3

From: Elizabeth Hill <ecsamhill@...>
Subject: Re: Conference airfares


<<I'm on the west coast too, but I went last year and it was awesome and
I'm probably going to go again this year. I'm watching for airfare
deals, from Los Angeles area to Boston, in case anybody happens to
notice a real super bargain!>>

Hi, Pam --

Are you going to be presenting any sessions either in MA or in CA?

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Conference airfares
messages.msgSnippet: ... In California, yes:  Unschooling, Mathematical Joy, How to NOT Pass on Math Anxiety, and a hands-on math fun workshop for parents and kids. -pam National
messages.messageBody:
On Apr 22, 2004, at 9:19 PM, Elizabeth Hill wrote:

> Are you going to be presenting any sessions either in MA or in CA?
>

In California, yes: Unschooling, Mathematical Joy, How to NOT Pass on
Math Anxiety, and a hands-on math fun workshop for parents and kids.

-pam

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Unschooling  Re: Sparks!!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/21/2004 9:03:56 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Sorry it took me so long to get back to you, but I have been asked a lot lately, and I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/21/2004 9:03:56 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
treegoddess@... writes:

> Hi, Sang! I was just curious as to what your "closing" says just above
> your name. I'm guessing it's Gaelic, but I could be wrong. :)
> -Tracy-
>

Sorry it took me so long to get back to you, but I have been asked a lot
lately, and I wanted to double-check and make sure I remember correctly before I
answered you! :~)

It is Celtic Gaelic and it means Peace on Earth. I know, sorta sappy, but its
a nice sentiment and I like to think it makes a bit of difference if I spread
it around ;~) Thanks for asking!

Síocháin ar domhan,
Sang

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Conference airfares
messages.msgSnippet: Southwest flies into Providence, RI  - 42 miles away they had $99 fares each way (from San Diego)  Check their website - I think it s southwestairlines.com.
messages.messageBody:
Southwest flies into Providence, RI - 42 miles away they had $99 fares each way (from San Diego) Check their website - I think it's southwestairlines.com.

That's what we're doing (but on earned free tickets). I'm going to rent a little compact - and that way we'll have wheels for some adventuring.

Susan

messages.msgSnippet: **Thanks for the tip on the conference, though! :~)** I like to think  that there s going to be a prize for the person who can slip it into conversation the
messages.messageBody:
**Thanks for the tip on the conference, though! :~)**

I like to think <g> that there's going to be a prize for the person who
can slip it into conversation the most times. It's fun AND
life-changing, so I figure it's always relevant on this list.

I'm on the opposite coast, so I get my jollies from encouraging other
people to go.

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Unschooling  Re: Sparks!!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/21/2004 10:28:36 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... No, I m not-I m in Ohio, actually. We do have statewide regs, but we notify our
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/21/2004 10:28:36 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
ecsamhill@... writes:

> However,
> in Massachussets, individual superintendents are allowed to set
> themselves up as tin-plated dictators. <g> Are you in MA?
>

No, I'm not-I'm in Ohio, actually. We do have statewide regs, but we notify
our superintendent each year, and some of them get on power trips and try to
demand more info than is required by law. From what I hear, it isn't many of
them, but the ones that are are very blatent and stubborn. The one we had up to
last year was one of these-openly and very vocally against homeschooling, but I
don't know how this new one is, yet. In fact, the old one left, he said, so
that he could go into politics and do away with the "abomination" of
homeschooling all together! Ohy... Thanks for the tip on the conference, though! :~)

Síocháin ar domhan,
Sang


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Unschooling  Re: Sparks!!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Sang -- I noticed you used the word superintendent in your post.  Most states in the US have consistent rules throughout the entire state.  However, in
messages.messageBody:
Hi, Sang --

I noticed you used the word "superintendent" in your post. Most states
in the US have consistent rules throughout the entire state. However,
in Massachussets, individual superintendents are allowed to set
themselves up as tin-plated dictators. <g> Are you in MA?

Because if you are, and you are just starting out, has anyone mentioned
the Live and Learn conference in August in Peabody?

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Unschooling  Re: Sparks!!
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry, I meant to send that privately.  :) -Tracy-
messages.messageBody:
Sorry, I meant to send that privately. :)
-Tracy-
